result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Walter Martin Lipscomb

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Walter Martin Lipscomb appeared by phone.  Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court for Walter Martin Lipscomb.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant appears on defense counsel telephone. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Walter Martin Lipscomb appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court for Walter Martin Lipscomb.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court vacates stayed warrant. Defense recently received an offer from the State and needs time to review. Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in court for status conference. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 30.  Calendar call scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Walter Martin Lipscomb in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Walter Martin Lipscomb appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense has discovery but no offer, and needs time to discuss with client. 
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Walter Martin Lipscomb in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Walter Martin Lipscomb appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  COURT ORDERS the following placement:
Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation. Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Nicholas Weege who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $25.00/month beginning on 10/1/2022 and on the 1st of every month thereafter until paid in full.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/28/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with V.R. and F.R.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Walter Martin Lipscomb in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant Refused Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/26/2022@2pm
